column2:
Delighted to sign new customs arrangements with Guernsey, Jersey and the Isle of Man this morning @hmtreasury. 

The arrangements mean that when the UK leaves the EU, traders moving goods between the UK and Crown Dependencies will continue to pay no customs duty.pic.twitter.com/GCAl5VluxL

Every month @tradegovuk meets with MPs from all parties to talk about the work my department is doing. Today we discussed how we are boosting UK exports - which have grown by £111 billion since the referendum - through our new Export Strategy #ExportingIsGREATpic.twitter.com/5uFKMX7tij

Proud to be the 455th woman elected - a special number because from when I was elected there was exactly as many men in Parliament as there had been women ever elected.https://twitter.com/UKParliament/status/1065163044236525568 …

Good meeting with @CatMcKinnell & @drcarolinej @HouseofCommons this afternoon planning next steps for the APPG for #children who need #palliativecare.  Exciting ideas - watch this space! @Tog4ShortLives @Tog4Policyhttp://www.togetherforshortlives.org.uk/appg

After a briefing this evening - time to study the detail. The Brexit agreement is available herehttps://www.gov.uk/government/publications/progress-on-the-uks-exit-from-and-future-relationship-with-the-european-union …
Great to open Second Reading of Finance Bill - shame Labour voted against tax cut for 32 million hard working people. #StriverStridepic.twitter.com/smU2IzxOUT

We cannot make the EU want to do a good economic deal with us: if their focus is their EU superstate and stopping any other members leaving, sadly so be it & we'll return to sorting out an FTA after we have left. But clearly a mutually beneficial deal now would be better for all.https://twitter.com/DavidDavisMP/status/1060928237142970369 …

.@WTO members are able to trade on uncertified schedules. Indeed, the EU is currently trading on uncertified schedules. After March 2019 the UK will be able to trade on its provisional schedules while we discuss with other members. Here's all the facts https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/when-we-speak-for-ourselves-we-flourish-and-our-status-in-the-wto-is-no-exception …

Latest @ONS figures show our economy grew 0.7% between June and August with retail, food and drink and housebuilding all performing well during the summer.
 
Since 2010 our economy has grown every year, there are 3m more people in work and we have cut income tax for 31m people.pic.twitter.com/3AjYh28BOB

From the very beginning, the EU offer has been a Canada+++ deal. Much further-reaching on trade, internal security and foreign policy cooperation. This is a true measure of respect. And this offer remains in place. #brexit

The UK exports more to the rest of the world than the EU, @ONS figures released today confirm.  Total exports outside the EU were £342.8bn in the year to June 2018 #FreeTradeUKpic.twitter.com/4749jX1Kjd

Jeremy Corbyn knows that what he is saying is absolutely untrue.  The Labour left have clearly made a conscious decision to keep repeating this lie.  So let me be clear yet again – we will not lower UK standards in Trade Agreements. #Marr

The #WelcomeToGREAT campaign is 7 today  So far it has:
 supported over 1,066 events in almost 200 locations
 secured confirmed economic returns of £3.4bn for the UK
 been backed by 640 businesses and high-profile individuals
 received 53 awards
#HappyBirthdayGREATpic.twitter.com/cYLhgEHPbj

In 2016 we made online marketplaces responsible for VAT fraud from non-EU businesses on their sites.

Since then, the number of non-EU e-businesses that have applied to register for VAT:

2015: 1,650

Now: 43,500

Proof our tough approach to tax evasion is working

Very welcome news today that GDP grew by 0.6% in three months to July - fastest growth for almost a year. More on the economy's strong performance here:https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-45470689 …

The latest @ons borrowing stats show a £2bn surplus in July (that means we raised more in tax than we spent that month) 

Debt is due to start falling next year (the first sustained fall in a generation) pic.twitter.com/y56GZlSuPt

July public finances in surplus by £2bn, the largest July surplus since 2000. Debt as a percentage of GDP was 84.3 per cent, 1.7 % lower than July last year. Our work is #payingoff. #surplus #debtdown

We’re determined to tackle #plasticpollution and have received massive public support for using the tax system to combat it - the largest ever response to @hmtreasury. We’re working hard on our plans and @PhilipHammondUK will be setting them out at the Budget.pic.twitter.com/D9PoQvQ1C7

New jobs figures released today from the @ONS show that in the past year:

The number of people in work has reached a record high.
Unemployment is at its lowest since 1975.
Wages are rising faster than prices.

We’ve made excellent progress in reducing government borrowing, but we cannot be complacent. We must reject the arguments of those who think debt can rise again without consequences.
